short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Makes your life easier when developing in GoodData Cloud BI platform

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
This tool makes your life easier when you are working with the GoodData platform.

The extension works with any custom/white-labeled domain (access permissions are required).

The extension does not collect any sensitive or personal user data. It only processes and reformats data available via public APIs and presents it to the user currently logged in to the GoodData platform in an existing browser session.

KEY FEATURES
 • Quick links to useful development resources (so-called “gray pages”)
 • Basic information about the workspace (project) available in two clicks
 • Log files presented in a user-friendly format, including a timeline of CloudConnect and SQL Executor phases and volumes of data uploaded by CloudConnect and Automated Data Distribution (ADD) V1 and V2 processes
 • Tools for retrieving information about metadata objects and their usage
 • A tool for debugging reports, insights, and metrics

For the full description of the extension and its features, please see the online documentation (https://bit.ly/gd-ext-help).

WHAT’S NEW
 • Removed links to GD Labs Model Viewer as it is getting removed
 • Parsing of ADDv2 logs in both single-workspace and segment load mode
 • The pencil edit button on KPI Dashboards is back and better than ever
 • Support for dark mode in logs
 • Improved SQL Executor parsing with detection of errors and navigation to SQLs with a click
 • New buttons for Domain Admins, SSO Providers and Edit mode for Metadata Objects
 • Detection if GoodData Platform is present on the hostname before enabling it
 • Detect and mark deprecated objects in the using/used menu
 • Numerical objectIDs and single-click-copy of the object URI in the used/using menu
 • Proper parsing of the LCM component logs
 • Improved handling of Object parsing even if only identifier and not objectID is in the URL
 • Migrated to Chrome manifest V3 (sound notifications are deprecated and config migration needed because of that)

WHAT’S FIXED
 • fixed issues with some features after Chrome 130 release
 • many small fixes here and there
